newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Journal Register makes debut.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Journal Register makes debut.

text.p: Shares of two companies made their debuts on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday, with newspaper publisher Journal Register Co stirring plenty of interest on Wall Street.
The stock vaulted to near the top of the Big Board's most-active list in afternoon trading. Shares were unchanged at their IPO price of 14 at midday after rising as high as 14-1/8.
The shares were priced lower than the Trenton, New Jersey, company's expected range of between $15 and $17 a share. The offering of 9.375 million shares raised about $130 million.
Morgan Stanley & Co Inc, Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette Securities and Merrill Lynch & Co were the offering's underwriters.
Morgan Stanley & Co Inc was the lead underwriter.

Journal Register publishes 18 daily newspapers and 118 other non-dailies in five main areas: Connecticut, Ohio, Philadelphia, St. Louis, and central New England. Its papers include the New Haven Register and the Trentonian.
